title: Portrait of an Artist

thumbnail.alt_text: Painting of a mustached man with a wide-brimmed black hat and white flat collar seen from the waist up, turned to the viewer.

credit_line: Hutchinson Colln. Gift of Charles L. Hutchinson

exhibition_history:
Art Institute of Chicago, A Century of Progress: Exhibition of Painting and Sculpture, June 1–November 1, 1933, no. 63.

Art Institute of Chicago, A Century of Progress: Exhibition of Painting and Sculpture, June 1–November 1, 1934, no. 91.

The Detroit Institute of Arts, An Exhibition of Fifty Paintings by Frans Hals, January 10–February 28, 1935, no. 40.
provenance_text: Presumably Prince Anatole Demidoff, Villa San Donato, near Florence (died 1870); by descent to his nephew Prince Paul Demidoff (died 1885) and included in the sale of the contents of Villa San Donato, March 15, 1880, lot 1105, bought in; remained in the Demidoff collection, passing into the possession of Paul Demidoff’s widow, Helena Troubetskoi, Pratolino, near Florence; included in the group of 13 paintings from the Demidoff collection sold to trustees of the Art Institute through Durand-Ruel, Paris in 1890; purchase price reimbursed by Charles L. Hutchinson, 1894.
